Lets rip off the bandaid: it is not as good as Sonic 1 and 2, but that doesn't mean that it is bad, quite the opposite, it's a good movie, but it falls short when compared to the first and second. The writing is not as good, many jokes are too corny, etc. If you like Sonic and/or watched the first two movies, sure, watch this, it's OK.
Jim Carrey is pretty good, as usual, and Keanu as Shadow is really nice, he really nails that depressed-frustrated-edgy voice.
My favorite of the series! Double Jim Carrey and add Shadow… makes for a great flick!

Sonic 3 delivers an enjoyable and energetic adventure that will please fans of the franchise. The visuals are bright and engaging, and the action sequences maintain a good pace throughout. The humor is light and often hits the mark, making it entertaining for both younger audiences and longtime fans. Some plot elements feel predictable and a few characters are underdeveloped, but these do not significantly detract from the fun experience. Overall, Sonic 3 is a solid entry in the series that entertains and excites, even if it does not fully reach its potential.

Rating: 7.8/10

A thrilling, emotional, and fan-service-filled installment with powerhouse performances.

Highlights
- Strong Story: Balances family-friendly tone with themes of loss, grief, and revenge.
- Great Performances: Keanu Reeves and Jim Carrey deliver standout performances.
- Faithful Adaptation: Respects source material, including iconic game sequences.

Criticisms
- Split Focus: Plot can feel like two different movies at times.
- Sidelined Characters: Supporting human cast feels underutilized.
- Tonal Balance: Struggles to balance somber and comedic tones.

Verdict
A massive, character-driven spectacle respecting its audience and source material. Recommended for fans and families seeking a sci-fi action-adventure.

Sonic 3 is an absolute mess of a film.
The story, on paper, does sound like a unique concept, but its ruined when Jim Carey returned as Dr. Eggman with no explanation, which you can tell that was a last minute rewrite into the film's production.
The jokes are terrible and unfunny, and sometimes cringe to even hear.
And they hired Keanu Reeves, who in my opinion, was a terrible actor for Shadow because he didn't have the right attitude and it felt like a marketing tactic rather than being an interesting addition.
Also, I blame the Knuckles TV series for ruining Sonic 3's reputation.
As for Sonic 4, no thanks, I've seen enough of the franchise.

This film is a masterpiece, the best of the franchise so far, and Shadow carried this film, and I liked the farewell to Robotnik and Agent Rocha, and Jim Carrey had an excellent performance with two characters.

If you are in for a treat of pop culture references, constant attempts to evoke the nostalgia of Sonic Adventure 3 and some of the laziest, corniest scriptwriting ever, this film is for you. And the action scenes, being some of the dullest, most stiffly choreographed ever conceived, just won't save that. 
So you may as well watch Sonic Prime instead.
